description: this place is very cute...great customer service!! Our server May was friendly and approachable. We ordered a lemon blueberry cupcake and it had just the right amount of tang!! Delicious! Can't wait to come back again :)
author: Alison H.

description:
I placed a 2-dozen mini custom photo cupcakes ($48) from them one day before I needed them. I used their app to order and it was super easy!

You can't choose the cupcake flavors but it didn't matter. All cupcakes were tasty and not overly sweet. You'll get 3 of each 4 flavors: Red Velvet, Chocolate, Vanilla, and Strawberry. 

The photo toppers are printed on edible frosting paper. They look really neat and special. I'd suggest something simple for the design. However, even if the design is complex, the printed quality will still be good. The only thing to note is that overtime, the frost papers do curl up a bit. 

They also reply to your email inquires very fast. I was able to change the pick-up time and received my order on time. 

I will definitely use them again in the future!
author: Alice L.

description: Tried the smores cupcake and thought it was alrightttt. Definitely nothing compared to Sprinkles. Cake was a bit dry, with a thin graham cracker bottom that I could barely taste. The topping was marshmallow whipped cream, except it wasn't really whipped cream. It was basically just marshmallow. I'm not a fan. Maybe another cupcake flavor would be better? Idk, I probably won't be back.
author: Kaitlynn L.

description: I have been to Cako more times than I can count. One of the things I like best about them is their originality. you can always find a new flavor to try. I especially enjoy it when they make my favorite things in cupcake form. When a flavor works, it REALLY works. A recent example is Birthday cake. Between all the sprinkles and the frosting, it had  happy thoughts of childhood flooding my brain. But when it doesn't work, it can be really disappointing. A recent example of that is the thin mint macaron. That is not only a specific flavor profile, it's a specific texture. A crispy texture that can't be repeated in a macaron. The cookie in question was actually lovely when taken on it's own merits, but disappointing when you expect a certain flavor profile. It seems picky I know, but I can assure you this would be a fail on Top Chef simply because of the name. I have had other macarons from them and really enjoyed them. Another thing I really appreciate at Cako is the frosting to cupcake ratio. It's just right. Some places overload you with a mouthful of butter. I like butter, but not in such large sugary doses that you see at other places..Cako has the perfect balance  Service wise, the people working always seem a bit bored, but no one has ever been rude. That said, I always enjoy a visit. It's a guilty pleasure when I happen to be at the Metreon.
author: Nicole M.

description: Cako cupcakes brings back a lot of memories because I used to work at a Cako in high school! I had a work event coming up and was looking for cupcakes with our company logo on it. I chose Cako but was a little nervous because I know Cako cupcakes can tend to be dry/old depending on the day (they used to resell old cupcakes). Luckily for delivery I think they use fresh cupcakes so all the cupcakes were soft! Still not the best or most moist cupcake I've ever had, but it delivered and the logo (printed onto fondant?) was a really nice touch. I was excited to order the strawberry cheesecake because I remembered it being very tasty, but they changed the cupcake since I last had it a couple years back. There used to be a middle filling of cheese which added the "cheesecake" element. The pink cupcake we got looked saturated with hot pink food dye and was overly sweet. Cream cheese frosting was tasty. Overall I would definitely order again if I needed customized cupcakes, but I would avoid the strawberry cheesecake and just stick with the red velvet. I remember tiramisu was my favorite, maybe I'll try it again next time :)
author: Hannah K.

description:
Stumbled upon this business while strolling through the Metreon and I have had my eye on it ever since. Today was the day - I FINALLY got to try it! 

[The bakery stand] 
Small and adorable place located in the Metreon amongst the other food court style restaurants. There is a Cako Creamery adjacent, but my eyes were focuses on the plump cupcakes sitting in the display case. There was also a rainbow of macarons. 

[The Service] 
There was one staff worker on site. Doesn't look like the place gets busy too often, which was a reason I was hesitant to try it at first. I wasn't sure how fresh or moist the cupcakes would be. The staff member was kind, no problems. 

[The Cupcake] 

-Tiramisu cupcake @ 3.78 per cupcake (including tax): It was YUMMMMYY! The frosting wasn't overly sweet at all (which I loved- since I normally hate the traditional sugary frosting), the frosting was fluffy and had a dust of cocoa powder on it. The cake was super moist and was half vanilla cake and half rum coffee flavored cake...mmmmmmmmm...my mouth is watering just thinking about it. If I wasn't in a rush to catch the metro, I probably would have gone back for a few more. 

We were extremely pleased with the cupcake and will probably come back on our next date near the Metreon. Now we know to get more than one cupcake!
author: Emily T.

description: If you need a sweet treat this will cure the craving. A convenient stop if you're shopping or out to lunch in the area. It's a cute little bakery stand with a bakery case full of mini and normal sized cupcakes. They had a bunch of flavors and toppings to choose from. I went with the classic vanilla on vanilla with rainbow sprinkles. The cake was super fluffy and the right ratio of frosting on top. An all around pleasant treat post-lunch for someone who's not usually down for sweets.
author: Breanna B.

description: After eating at another spot in Metreon I knew I had to grab one of these cupcakes on the way out. They just look so damn tasty in all their pics! Once we found the small stand it was hard to narrow it down. I felt like going classic so I got a vanilla cupcake with chocolate frosting. Man oh man was it good! The chocolate frosting was super rich and fudgey which complimented the moist yellow cake so well. Next time I'm in the Metreon I'd be remiss not to stop and pick up a cupcake again!
author: Holly K.

description: Want to go to a cupcake place that tops Kara's cupcakes in Walnut Creek or SF? Then this is the place to go! I think if you get anything from here you won't be disappointed. Their cupcakes are super fluffy, moist and they whipped cream is so good! It is super hard not to eat more than 1 or maybe 2? Lol I definitely recommend to anyone that has not tried this place!
author: Anne R.

description:
My cupcake problem at work continues. Last Tuesday, April 26th was one of my coworkers' last day. A talent of ours was nice enough to bring by a huge box of cupcakes.

I've only had mini cupcakes from Cako. This was the first time I've tried one of their regular sized cupcakes. My love of pink made me choose the Strawberry Cheesecake Cupcake: tangy smooth cheesecake drizzled with ripe, sweet strawberries and syrup, made of moist strawberry cake, creamy cheesecake center baked into the cake and topped with a dollop of cream cheese frosting. I adore their mini cupcakes, but the full size one just didn't seem as good. The cake was too moist, so not light and springy. Not quite mushy, but close. The frosting was light and creamy, like I remember.

I like Cako's cupcakes, but I prefer their mini ones. The cake and frosting ratio per bite seems to be better. And I liked the cake itself more in the mini versions. Still, Cako does serve up a pretty good cupcake.
author: Elena N.

description:
Super cute little place in the Metreon with all kinds of desserts like macarons, cupcakes and some other baked odds and ends.

Quick service, delicious macarons (just tried nutellla, others looked amazing). Will definitely be back for some cupcakes in the near future.
author: Bob K.

description: Everything is great about this place except the girl who works there. She is so mean and rude I had to leave before I ordered because of her attitude. For management: she is working now (1:30pm on Friday the 16th.)
author: Reda D.

description: AMAZING CUPCAKES!!! Best in the area,  they are moist and so delicious! So worth a taste!!! Service wasn't the greatest,  but it's all about the cupcakes! Chocolate chocolate was my favorite!
author: Miriam H.

description: I don't get what they do because I got cookies from Sugarcraft Bakery delivered through Cako's website. So they sell cupcakes but also are Bakery brokers that deliver everyone else's stuff? Either way, website was super easy to use and everything was delivered as promised for my husband's birthday in the city.
author: Annie M.

description:
The Cake:  The first test of any cupcake (or cake) is to try the actual 'cake' first without the frosting.   Often, bakers will cover a mediocre or lacking, cake with overly sweet frosting to compensate.  Cāko's cake was good.   It didn't taste like store box yellow cake.   It's was nicely flavored but subtle and not overwhelming.

The Frosting:  Perfectly sweet for my tooth's tastes.  The combination of maple, frosting and bacon were well balanced and none of them overpowered the other. 

The Service:  Feb 1st 12:15pm.  Very friendly and answered all my questions.   Went through and told me about their best sellers, their seasonals, the others, and offered me a sample of one of their seasonals.

5 stars across the board.
author: Cap P.

description:
Cako to the rescue! I made a last minute Eat24 order for 3 dozen minis an hour and a half before we needed them... and they delivered! 

At 5 pm on a weeknight, it's hard to find a bakery that's still open, let alone with enough baked goods to appease 20 people at the end of the day. 

Ordering online was a piece of cake (pun intended) and the delivery driver followed instructions perfectly, calling my cell when he was in the lobby of my hotel. 

The minis were thoroughly enjoyed and another win for Cako.
author: Abby S.

description:
Horrible experience.  Racist.  Terrible customer service!!!
I purchased 2 cupcakes, handed the young man helping me a $50 bill.  The woman standing behind him looked at us and proceeded to tell me that they do not accept anything over a $20 because they don't have change.  That would have been fine until she followed it by saying it was their store policy to not accept anything over a $20.  Which one is it?  I then asked her where the policy was posted.  She stated that they don't have it posted but it is the policy of the entire Metreon Center to not accept bills over $50.  I have a very difficult time believing the movie theater, Target, and the surrounding stores do not accept bills over $50.  We had a few words, my son used his card to diffuse the situation and we walked off.  As I walk off and in front of the line, she starts using the foulest language about how tired she is of Black people using race all the time.  Little did she know, my niece was in line behind me and heard everything.  She told the woman at the counter that she needs to be careful about the language she uses when referring to customers, especially when there are other customers listening.  Not to mention, not knowing who you are speaking in front of because she just happened to be family. 
 
Needless to say, I tossed the nasty cupcake in the trash.
author: Eileen G.

description: Great customer service from Tina! I ordered custom logo cupcakes and they were on time (and super accommodating with the delivery times) and delicious! Our logo looked great on top of yummy cupcakes! Super helpful and friendly service. I will definitely order from here again.
author: Dory R.

description: Redeemed a free birthday cupcake and chose cookie butter. The cake itself was crumbly and on the dry side. The frosting was too sweet. The overall cupcake would be a rip off if one were to purchase it because it's small.
author: Tammy P.

description:
Meh. I don't think that this cupcake was worth the pricetag, but when you want sweets, you want sweets. 

Ordered the Oreo cookies and cream cupcake on a Wednesday evening (only because they were out of the red velvet cupcakes). Should have taken that as an indication that the leftovers would be just that -- leftovers, but I decided to get one anyways. I asked for a suggestion and was told that the Oreo cookies and cream one was good, so I gave it a try. Honestly, not my favorite cupcake. The cake itself was a bit dry, but the worst part was the frosting: I could feel the granules of sugar in it, which was not appealing at all. I finished it, of course, but would almost have been okay throwing it away.

Not sure if it was the time of day, or just that day, or a regular occurrence, but I was quite underwhelmed with this Cako. Probably won't be back to try again, although possibly will try it in the afternoon to see if time of day is the culprit..
author: Julia N.

description:
Very standard cupcakes, but they were a little bit too sweet for me. I did enjoy the maple bacon cupcake though, even though the frosting was super sweet! Red velvet was very standard but I did prefer it to Sprinkles' red velvet. The strawberry wasn't particularly memorable for me. Samoas was definitely way too sweet for my personal preference.

If you have a ridiculous sweet tooth, the cupcakes here would definitely satiate it. I don't know if I would order cupcakes here again, but at least the woman working there was super sweet (see the trend?) and was helpful when my friend and I were picking out flavors. Good service is always a plus!
author: Trisha V.

description: I picked up a dozen cupcakes today and was very disappointed with the service for the price point. The girl was on her phone with her back to me so I had to call her to get her attention. She asked for my order number with "order number?" which I gave her after looking it up, at which point then she pushed a bag to me without another word like it was any other bag and went back to stare at her phone.
author: Saliem C.

description:
So...
I'm literally standing in front of Cako at 10:10p... and it's closed, but yelp states it's open til 11p. Let's update the listing so I don't walk across town for a macaroon sandwich at 10p. Disappointed.
author: Chelsea B.

description:
If I could give less than 1 star I would! YUCK! I love macaroons. We got 4 (me and my co workers) the second I bit into mine I knew it had been freezer burned! Frozen and thawed it tasted like I licked someone's freezer horrible! The outside was crunchy and thick, the inside had no flavor I haven't spit food out in recent memory but this was spit out and the rest were thrown in the trash, don't bother stopping in here till they fix this issue, it wasn't just mine, my co workers also had the same complaints, $10.50 I would have been better off lighting that money on fire. Gross AVOID this place. Lesson learned. If I hadn't needed to get back to work I would have walked back in. 

Zero point zero is the score out of 10
author: Nena L.

description:
Amazing...

Hands down , just perfectly made cupcakes.
Went there off a fluke just because it was the nearest sweets store and just opened a door that probably will not be closing anytime soon.

Moist strawberry cheesecake cupcakes & snicker cupcakes have now become a weekday ritual!
author: Tyler G.

description: There was a nice denseness to the Birthday Cake cupcake but flavor was ordinary. Lots of frosting up top which wasn't super sweet but sweet nonetheless. $4+ for a serving is expensive. Either that or I'm just not knowledgable on what cupcakes cost these days.
author: Julie L.

description:
This place was great. They offer a wide variety of cupcakes and macaroons. Their prices are pretty fair and the staff is very friendly. Presentation is pretty decent, especially being a last minute stop in.
They told me everything is baked fresh daily which is always key at a bakery.

I ordered a variety of flavors for a client and the only thing I wish they provided were branded name tags for the boxes or assortment however, they were really helpful writing out the flavors per each box. A for effort ;) 

I'd come back again!
author: Brigette B.

description:
The cake itself is actually pretty dry--feels like the crumbs are just coating your throat. The frosting though is delicious. Not overly sweet and grainy. 

Try the Red Velvet, Tiramisu, Rich & Famous, and Carrot. All safe flavors and not bad. Pretty much your average cupcake joint.
author: Jennifer M.

description: While waiting in the Metreon today for my friends to arrive I could resist it and finally tried a cupcake from Cako. The girl behind the counter was very nice and sweet. I ordered a red velvet cupcake and although it was pricey ($3.50) it was absolutely delicious. The cream on top was just so good I know if I had no restraint I could eat a bucket full it was that good. The red velvet part was nice and moist too. It's definitely one of those places I don't need to eat at, but if I ever have a sweet tooth that needs to be taken care of I will definitely stop by and try another flavor.
author: James R.

description:
Service was friendly.  I had a Facebook coupon for a free cupcake.  The little deal wouldn't bring up the correct screen to accept it but the girl called over who I think was a manager from Cako Creamery across the way and he okayed it.  I finally decided on the strawberry cupcake.  I'm not sure if I went with the wrong flavor, but it was totally a waste of calories!  The cake was moist, but there was ZERO flavor at all in the cake and the frosting.    So, needless to say, it didn't taste like a strawberry cheesecake or anything for that matter.  

I hate Sprinkles, but even their cupcakes have more flavor.  Also, the prices vary but seem to be about $3.25-$3.75 for a cupcake.  I'm glad that I didn't shell out the money for it.  I hope they improve their recipe.
author: Cat C.

description:
Unfortunately, their customer service (order@cako.com) is probably the worst I've experienced. I was in need to order a cake asap and nobody responded to me (til this day since). I really DO enjoy their cupcakes however customer service is everything, especially when I frequent there often and refer many businesses and friends. 

I got my delicious cake elsewhere and stopped buying at Cako altogether. I've taken my clients and friends elsewhere as well. 

In general, all businesses should make customer service a top priority. Even if you read an email too late, still respond to people's email. Realize that one person can spread the words to their clients and friends, to not patron there. 

Maybe in the near future, I'll send another email to see if customer service imrpoved any...but for now, not a satisfied ex-regular customer.
author: amanda t.

description:
Overrated & overpriced cupcakes.  

My cousin spent like $30 here..

The only thing that was good was the Tiramisu cupcake, but paying almost $4 for it really kills it.

The app is also a pain....it's SOOOO much work to get that free cupcake and it's only for the Iphone.  If you guys are gonna claim it, stand to the side for 15 minutes before lining up to order....
The girls who were working there could have warned us, or at least help us as we were struggling to register....

We kept the line backed up, and they didn't have the decency to have the second girl working to man the other cashier....
author: David W.

description:
I remember working at Nordstrom at Westfield when the first Cako opened in the food court. I was so excited and it was all the rave. It's been a few years and I just don't know what happened. I've always ordered the Red Velvet but it just doesn't taste the same as it used to. 

I applaud them for trying out some funky flavors every now and then but wished the basics were as good as they used to be.
author: Leina K.

description: After watching Star Wars my boyfriend and I decided to pick up a few cupcakes to try :) We decided on the Reeses peanut butter cupcake, the oreo cupcake, and an all chocolate cupcake (pictured). I am a cupcakeaholic and was very impressed with these cupcakes. The only downside was the actual cake was a little dry but that is probably because I decided to stop here around 8 at night. I'm sure they are a lot more fresh in the morning. Oh, and the girl who helped me was super nice and friendly. I was very impressed with my experience here! :) I will definitely be back next time I am in San Francisco.
author: Justine C.

description:
This place is slowly starting to turn into a regular spot for me -- which is probably NOT a good thing. 

I simply cannot eat cupcakes anywhere else. They are by far the best cupcakes I have ever had! The red velvet and strawberry cheese cake are my favorites. I wish I could eat two a day. Sooooo good!!
author: Farnaz K.

description: Pretty moist cupcakes, but nothing too special about them. I tried the tres leches, birthday cake, & snickerdoodle cupcakes, and they all pretty much tasted like grocery store bought cupcakes that were vanilla flavored. If I had to choose, I liked the snickerdoodle the most.
author: Erika-Kelly C.

description:
Cake muffins. It's shaped like a muffin with the consistency of a cake. Topped with icing and sprinkles.

I die.

(Because I eat too many cake muffins, but it's a happy way to go.)
author: Tiffany N.

description: About 3.50$ per cupcake. Strawberry cake with chocolate chips and bright green frosting to look like a summer watermelon. Carrot cake had creamy cream cheese frosting and little bits of carrot. Oreo cupcake had stale mini Oreo on the top and stiff frosting, but all he cupcakes are light and fluffy and moist. Yummy.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I've walked by these tempting patisserie-white booths in the Metreon for years now and finally stopped in to knock this off my San Francisco Ice-cream list.  In a word:  Disappointing.

Ice-Cream:  2 stars
There's a very buttercreamy base flavour like cheap Cold Stone that softens like butter. I tried the Bailey's and Birthday cake flavours and wasn't impressed.  Can't see myself ever purchasing ice-cream here, when there are better pints to be bought in any drugstore.

Cupcakes:  3 stars
The Tiramisu was nice and light, very soft and moist.  I would pick these up in a pinch.
author: Letitia L.

description:
I may or may not have eaten 3 cupcakes from here in back to back days. Don't judge me. They're really good, okay?

It's a delightfully fluffy cupcake topped with a perfectly sweetened, yet light and whipped, frosting. Any and all combinations I've tried are fantastic. 

Must. Have. More. Cupcakes. Seriously, the hunger pains and drool are starting to kick in...
author: Lina H.

description: I've found a new guilty pleasure! I saw a lady going down the street holding a beautiful mini bag with a cute cupcake and thought, hmmm, where'd she get that. A few more steps and I found bliss. This is definitely a once in a while spot because of the price. I bought 4, planning on saving a few in the freezer for different treats. My favorite was the maple Bacon cupcake! I loved maple Bacon .... orgasmic! I would love this cake as a wedding cake! The flavors just lingered pleasantly in my mouth!!! Fantastic...OMG!
author: Gwen H.

description:
I've been on their email list for awhile but I don't think I had the chance to get to one of their SF stores. A few weeks ago I was at the Metreon -- in one of its numerous incarnations -- and was torn between Cako cupcakes or ice cream. No, I can't do both!

I took a few cupcakes home with me and thoroughly enjoyed them. The cake was moist but not too moist and the icing was plentiful but not too sweet or plentiful.
author: Leslie K.

description:
I will first say that the cupcakes at Cako are quite tasty - the Rich and Famous is quite possibly one of the best chocolate cupcakes I've ever had (rivals Miette's chocolate with Italian meringue which is my all-time favorite).  But this review is about the quality of the decorations for their cookies and cupcakes. 

I order from Cako quite often - we get them at our office for various functions and I have amassed several points to be used for purchases.  Since it's Easter I went on their website and saw the very cute Easter sugar cookies they were offering.  I'm not even a huge sugar cookie fan but I thought it would be a nice addition to the desserts at our Easter Sunday dinner.  They were $40 for a dozen - outlandish by any standard but if they were very nicely decorated then I thought it would be a good use of my points (I would never in a million years pay $40 for a dozen cookies out of my pocket).  

The picture on the left is the picture that is shown on their website.  The flower cookie is iced completely and has a decoration on top, the egg cookie is iced to the edges with different colored decorations on top.  The picture on the right is what I received.  I could have decorated these in my kitchen.  I'm so disappointed.  If the cookies had cost $15 for a dozen and I got them at Safeway then I wouldn't expect much.  But when you charge $40 for a dozen cookies they better be the most beautiful and delicious cookies you've ever seen or eaten.

So, so, disappointing - and now I've wasted a bunch of my points on something that I could have made at home and decorating, quite frankly, even nicer than these.
author: Donna C.

description: Red velvet cupcake was decent (3 stars), but can't say I'd spend another $4 on cupcakes that taste like they're from box mix.
author: Nicola L.

description: Went to the metreon location. Wasn't really looking for sweets but noticed it when walking on the metreon. Ordered to cupcakes the red velvet and the strawberry cheesecake. Awesome cupcakes moist and frosting was smooth met in your mouth. Next time I will try the macaroons... Awesome...
author: Jennifer M.

description:
It's a little expensive here, but the service and taste of the cupcakes are both great! 

Major props to Galaxy, the very helpful and friendly lady who helped me to pick out the right flavors for what would be a very -sweet- gesture for a friend's birthday.  It was fairly dead in the mall, so when I made a special request to add a letter-shaped fondant to the top of the cupcake, another helpful lady was able to make one for me, while also offering me samples of their tasty but equally pricey macaroons. 

Speedy, friendly customer service always deserves Yelp recognition as a thank you!
author: Stephen D.

description: I had the strawberry cheesecake cupcake & the lemon blueberry cupcake. The strawberry cheesecake was delicious. The  lemon blueberry was not bad but not amazing. The cream cheese frosting is perfect.
author: Celly B.

description:
What a convenient location!  I decided to try a strawberry cheesecake because the displays were so tempting.  Coffee along with cupcake is a must in my book.  

Fortunatey for my waistline, I probably will not buy another cako cupcake because it was so dense and had a grainy texture like cornbread.  

Unfortunately for my waistline, I will just go to the Cako creamery literally across the hall.
author: Miran C.

description:
+ interesting macaron flavors, like black sesame and thai tea
+ interesting cupcake flavors, like pink lemonade and tiramisu
+ prices for cupcakes are reasonable
- cupcakes are overly sweet
author: Sherry L.

description:
When I returned to the Yelp office yesterday after lunch, I was green with envy the moment I saw several coworkers' cupcakes. Especially the one with jimmies (that's another word for sprinkles, west coasters). I would not make the same mistake of missing out on today's lunch break. 

My lunch buddy and I polished off our meal and headed straight for the METREON. Lots of flavors greeted us from the case at Cako, but only one received our full attention. We brought our sprinkled booty back to the office (in no-smush travel bags, mind you). The cake was perfectly moist and the thick layer of icing was sugary sweet, just the way I like it. A return visit before the week is out is probable.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Going to keep this one short and sweet (sweet... cupcakes... see what I did there?) I might get pelted with stones by Michelle C and Tiffany N, but these cupcakes are just so-so for me. Three solid stars for the presentation and packaging... so very cute! These would make a GREAT gift for someone, and they're a good size if you want to eat one all by yourself. 

It's the icing, I think. I just don't like it. I'm a fan of buttercream icing and the vanilla icing that topped my cupcake was so overly sweet that I felt my teeth cringing in fear with every bite. I do look forward to trying other kinds and maybe I will like those much better. I can, however, vouch for my colleagues mentioned above that are both huge fans of Cako - they definitely loved what was being served up.

It's worth a shot. The price isn't too bad, and the cupcakes come in a great looking bag. Give it a try if you're in the Metreon!
author: Aimee K.

description:
In Yerba Buena park.

Strange desire for Cookies

Pull out Yelp and ask it for "Cookies"

Result 1: Specialty's has great cookies but is a full block away.

Result 2: Cako!  

Right inside the mall!  Perfect.

Cupcakes though, not cookies.  Are cupcakes cookies?  No.  Are they an acceptable substitute?  Absolutely!  

Thanks Cako (and Yelp).  I feel better now.
author: Travis B.

description:
Flavorful, moist cupcakes! 
The red velvet with cream cheese frosting was delicious - not too sweet.
author: Maria L.

description:
I'd like to preface this review by saying the cupcakes at Cako are actually pretty tasty, and it's been one of my go-to cupcake spots in SF for the past two years. However, after my most recent experience, I'm definitely in the market for a new cupcake spot.

TLDR: I placed a simple, standard order of 6 Red Devil Ice Cream Cupcakes with Cako, and they messed up the ice cream filling inside as well as the frosting on top.

This past weekend was my sister's birthday celebration, and we all like ice cream cake, so Cako was an obvious choice, since they make ice cream cupcakes (Individual portions of ice cream cake? Yes, please!). Since it was already Thursday night, and I needed the cupcakes for a Saturday night dinner, I called the Cako store at the Metreon to confirm whether the cupcakes would be ready in time if I placed the order that night/Friday morning. The girl I spoke to was really awesome (I think her name was Melanie?) and informed me that they would be ready in time, so I placed my order on Friday morning. She even gave me a 10% off code to use online!

My order details:

Shipping Method: Store Pick Up - Metreon
Delivery Information: 2014-03-08     4:00pm-6:00pm 
Item: Red Devil Ice Cream Cupcake 
SKU: 623300
Quantity: 6
Subtotal: $30.00

Seemed straightforward enough, right? I ended up not going with custom cupcakes, and I just chose one of their standard options, Red Devil Ice Cream Cupcakes, which has a red velvet base cupcake, red velvet ice cream, and cream cheese frosting (http://www.cako.com/red-velvet-red-velvet-cream-cheese-ice-cream-cupcake.html).

Saturday evening, I went to Cako to pick up my ice cream cupcakes. The Creamery side didn't have my order, but the Cupcake side did. However, when one of the Cako employees handed me my ice cream cupcakes, I noticed that the frosting on top was chocolate, not cream cheese, so I asked if those were the correct cupcakes. She said yes and that they were the red velvet cupcakes, and she even checked the freezer to see if there were any other cupcake orders there (there weren't). I asked why there was chocolate frosting and not cream cheese frosting, and she looked confused, but said she would scrape off the chocolate frosting and re-frost the cupcakes for me. 5 minutes later, I had ice cream cupcakes with the correct (cream cheese) frosting, and I left a little disgruntled over the hassle they caused. They did offer me a free regular cupcake for my trouble, but that definitely didn't make up for being late to my sister's birthday dinner.

But wait, it gets better (read: worse). When we cut into the cupcakes after dinner, the ice cream inside was chocolate, aka NOT red velvet ice cream. (See the photo I uploaded.) Seriously? I specifically ordered one of the standard options so that the order would be fairly simple and there wouldn't be much confusion over the flavours.

Just to recap, there are three components to an ice cream cupcake: (1) cupcake base, (2) ice cream filling, (3) frosting. Cako got two of the three wrong on one of their standard ice cream cupcake options. For $5 a cupcake you would think they could get it right.

Will not be coming back.
author: Krystal M.

description:
PRICY AND MEH.

Maybe I have become spoiled having access to a Sprinkles and several other bakeries in my area, or even the fact that I can bake very well on my own, I was simply not impressed with what I received here.

While displayed beautifully with what sounded like some quality choices, each cupcake was sadly dry, and relied way too much on the frosting and toppings to pass off as a decent cake. Add to the fact that I think they actually charge more than sprinkles and you end up with a Meh. I've experience better. 

Bake your own, or find a better shop, but whatever you do, don't pay these marked up prices for sub standard cupcakes.
author: Adam A.

description:
Review is based on my gift card purchase.

Went to Cako to purchase 2 gift cards as birthday gifts.  I wanted increments of $25 each which would total up to $50.  Was asked for my credit card, swiped it, and then uh oh..something happened.  Was told that I will need my credit card swiped again,and that the previous transaction did not "go through".  I asked to verify that I did not get charged and the employee said that she guarantees that I wasn't.  I believed her as she proceeded to swipe my credit card again for the purchases of 2 gift cards at $25 each.  No receipt, nothing as I was hurried away due to a growing line.  

A week later, looking at my bank account, come to find that in fact I was charged $50 twice!  

I understand that sometimes technical difficulties happen, but I felt like someone took $50 away from me.  

So beware, I would not purchase gift cards from here.  If you do, use cash.  

I boycott this store.
author: Bernie C.

description: Cako was great! I wanted to buy a birthday cupcake, but a lot of places were closed in the morning. I went to this Cako at the Metreon and though they were not yet officially open, they still allowed me to purchase a cupcake with a smile. And the cupcake was nice!
author: Eric M.

description: I like their mini cupcakes. I am game for their red velvet and double chocolate anytime.
author: Sunil R.

description: I gotta give it up to Cako. Their packaging and designs are super cute. I had a couple of mini-cupcakes and they were just right.
author: Erika E.

description: The cupcakes are light and fluffy. I had the Peppermint and Chocolate Cupcake and the frosting was very good. It was perfect and top quality. Highly recommended.
author: Anita P.

description:
The Creme brûlée with wasnt up to specs ! The raspberry was perfect and the frosting/filling seemed dietetic ,lardy and barely edible ! The small girl at the counter replied no after I asked them if they use lard and said the crushed crunchy candy should be in it ! I told them it was like a piece of carrot cake with tasteless frosting ! Ew ! Looks pretty sweet ! 
Yet I wanted a bit of dessert so Subway Cookies are a no fail option I chose !
author: Abraham L.

description:
As soon as I walked inside the New Metreon my eyes instantly saw this pink looking bakery to the left. I slowly made my way over to check out my options and purchased the Red Velvet, as well as the Tiramisu. Then, my boyfriend and I made our way over to the park right next door, near the children's museum thing, and dug our forks inside our cupcakes. 

It was a good sign... cupcakes were soft and moist... My red velvet was pretty good. Although I'm not too much of a red velvet fan, I always have the need to try out every cupcake stores red velvet, just to compare I guess and see if I'll eventually like it as much as everyone around me. I absolutely loved the frosting on it; not too sweet and not crazy thick. The tiramisu was just alright for me; didn't really think it was anything special, besides it made me horribly thirsty.

The girl working there wasn't really helpful either. She just stood there looking at us while we were trying to decide which to pick. She didn't bother putting in her two cents or making small chit-chatter...

Three stars for okay cupcakes that sell them for $3.25 (pretty pricey).
author: Jorgess M.

description: Hands down the best cupcakes I've had. First had them last December, back this summer with my family and we all loved them. Had one today and high quality continues. I'll be going back to take some home with me!
author: Donna C.

description:
While visiting my girlfriend in the Bay Area, we were looking for a sweets place similar to Milk in Los Angeles, CA. We came across this little place in the mall and decided to check it out. We both ended up getting two orders of their strawberry cheesecake ice cream sandwiched between two pistachio macarons ($5 each).

Cako is split with two stands on each side of this particular part of the mall. One side had cupcakes and the other had ice cream.

The pistachio macaron was good, but pretty hard to bite off of. It wasn't soft and was pretty chewy like a cold cookie. However, their strawberry cheesecake ice cream was on point. It was delicious, and our server gave us a generous portion for the ice cream.

Our server was very nice, helpful, and patient even when my card wasn't going through the first couple of times. Although pricey, their ice cream goes into the "one of the most delicious ice creams I'll never buy again" category.
author: Raymond M.

description:
I've tried maybe two dozen cupcakes in the last couple of years, and the best ones I have had were at this Cako.

My expectations for cupcakes are high, probably because I have watched too much Cupcake Wars. 

Here are the pet peeves I have with most cupcake places: cake that's too dry; frosting that's too sweet; and cupcakes with way, way, way too much frosting. That last problem is *everywhere*, and it drives me nuts. Why must so many cupcake places put 3 inches frosting on the cake? So much frosting that you have to eat it separately from the cupcake, because it doesn't fit in your mouth or just falls off the cake, which defeats the purpose of having a cupcake? Enough already with the frosting madness, America!

Here is why Cako's cupcakes were a success in my book:

1) Reasonable cake-to-frosting ratio
2) Frosting was fairly light, fluffy... Not a giant wad of sugar.
3) Interesting flavors
author: C. C.

description:
Cako makes pretty decent cupcakes. I've been to all their locations but have been buying from this one the most since I've been going to the Metreon more often for movies and Target. Cako is pretty good and can cure the sweet tooth/cravings, but I just wish they were more consistent. 

The first time I ever had a cupcake from Cako, it was amazing. Then I noticed about every other time, the cupcake is just so not worth the $3 something. Every other time I get a cupcake from here, the cupcakes taste old and dry. Needless to say, when the cupcakes are fresh, I like their Back to Basics the most.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
cako has a kiosk at the entrace of metreon. about 12 kinds of cupcakes on display, selling for either 3.25 or 3.50. friendly greeting from staffer. told her i would come back to buy a cupcake. she was so happy!. priceless.

2 kinds of cookies available. single person staffs each kiosk. opposite kiosk sold gelato.

eats: tiramisu cupcake (3.5)
-spongy, moist cake base
-topping had whipped cream lite flavoring wtih streak  of chocolate, tiramisu taste.
-cupcake very fresh.
3.5 stars.
author: Victor G.

description: This location is a small stand in a mall. There are two stands - one of cupcakes and one for ice cream. I came here with a friend, ordered the s'mores cupcake, friend ordered the pumpkin cheesecake. My s'mores cupcake was dry and was probably sitting in that case for 2+ days. The cake itself was not moist at all, had no flavor, and the marshmallow frosting was very dry as well. When I took bite, the entire topping fell off in one piece, which tells me this cupcake is old. I would give this cupcake 1 star. My friend's pumpkin cheesecake was better. I would say it was made that day or the day before, much more moist, and the frosting was tasty but very sweet. I would rate this cupcake a 3. Overall, I did not enjoy my experience and felt as if the cupcake was old, dry, no flavor, and very small for the price.
author: Jessica L.

description: I got two mini cupcakes and half a dozen french macarons. The cupcakes were decent. I like Kara's cupcakes better. The macarons were fantastic though!!!! So many great flavors. They only problem was they're aren't refrigerated so they broke very easy in the bag the lady gave me. I had to put them in my purse because it was raining and had other items to carry. I would certainly come back for the macarons though.
author: Tina S.

description: I only had a tiny salted caramel macaroon, but it was pretty yummy and only $2. Can't wait to try something else next time!
author: Tiffany M.

description:
I recently ordered a custom cake for one of our employees who just retired.  I got the notice from my boss on Thursday to be delivered on Monday.  So I called to place the order and was shocked that they were able to accommodate me. The Bay Areas public transportation suffered a strike and it disrupted my way to get to San Francisco, so I was in panic mode because I made the order just the week before and wouldn't be able to make to work.

This also caused a problem with the retiring employee for which the cake was made for because he was affected by the strike as well.  I immediately sent an email to CAKO and without missing a beat they told me that the could hold off the delivery until Wednesday.  In the back of my mind I was saying how will the cake stay fresh as it will sit for several days before it gets delivered.  So on Wednesday the cakes were delivered and when I took a peek at the custom cake, it was perfect!  

Everything I requested was on the cake and it was beautiful.  I was nervous about how it would taste when the time came to cut it.  I have to say that I got a A+ from my director and all others that attended the office retirement party.  The white cake was moist and delicious.  It was easy to cut and the butter cream was not as sweet as other cakes I have tasted.  I mentioned that I ordered another cake from them that was an 8 inch cake with fruit on top.  That cake went immediately and the employees loved it!  I can't thank you enough for your wonderful customer service and prompt delivery.  I am so happy and I will be ordering all of my desserts from you in the future.
author: brenda t.

description: I was sold on the rainbow sprinkle cupcake.  The icing was nott overly sweet.  Cake was moist.  I would definitely buy again.
author: AJ M.

description:
Review is for the ice cream:

While the quality and flavors are good enough, the service left a bad taste in my mouth. The husband and I came here and ordered two single scoops in cups. While looking at the menu, I realized that if we got a double scoop in one cup, we could save three dollars. I asked the server if we could switch our order and put both scoops in one cup. She declined my request and we were force to pay $7 for two itty bitty single scoops. Paying an extra $3 doesn't bother me, it's the principle of the matter.

If you're in the mood for ice cream, I'd recommend skipping Cako and walking a few blocks to the Grove where the menu boasts a giant, sharable offering of artisan ice cream made by Three Twins for around $4. Even better, you get to pick two flavors. :)
author: Kel S.

description: Cako is so delicious, the best I've had in a long time.  These were moist dense and sweet cupcakes.   I had a strawberry cheesecake and a maple bacon doughnut cake for dinner and they were really good old fashioned empty calories; but definitely make me hit the bliss point. If you get one to go, it comes in a little bag with a plastic stay in it to hold your cupcake upright.  I can't think of anything that would make them better except if I had bought more. In retrospect I should have brought home some for my husband but I figured it wouldn't make it home in BART unharmed.  Buttercream is very delicate!  Too bad for hubs.
author: Stephanie L.

description: They sell Silvanas here! It's a Filipino dessert that's like a wafer with a thin layer of cream & powder on top. It was my first time trying it & it's unlike anything I've ever had! :0 They're $2 for one. I'd go back again, probably just for the Silvanas. Their cupcakes are a bit too sweet for me.
author: Ruhjeenuh Z.

description: Passing by on my way to catch the bus and decided to get a cupcake. And boy am I glad I did. I got the Pink Lemonade and the cake was moist and the frosting was so yummy. It was a little too much frosting for my liking but overall it was good!
author: Veronica R.

description: This review is just for the donut muffins. Ordered a few dozen as a surprise for my husband. They were suuuper dry and not moist at all. Too bad. Donut muffins sounded like such a good thing. Maybe the cupcakes are better though!
author: Gina R.

description:
Service was good, but that's about it.  I've had too many cupcakes at too many places and I think these are the worst I've had.  I got one bacon, maple cupcake and one pink lemonade cupcake as well as one maple bacon donut cupcake and one red velvet donut cupcake.  

I also went across the way to pick up a almond ice cream strawberry macaron pie.  

The maple bacon donut cake was terrible.  The bottom was frosted in what tasted like lard and there was nowhere near enough bacon to help with the flavor.  The cake was way too sweet and dry and the icing was too sweet with no special flavor at all.  

The cupcake version was slightly better because there was more bacon to help with the overwhelming sweetness of the cake and frosting.  Still was not impressive.  

The pink lemonade cupcake had great texture but the lemonade flavor was almost non-existent in the overly sticky frosting.  

The red velvet donut cupcake was the best because it had great texture but no chocolate flavor and the icing was underwhelming.  

None of the pastries tasted the least bit refined and I did not feel like I was buying from a bakery.  

Lastly, the macaron was so dry and crumbly and the best part was definitely the ice cream.  I don't think I will every buy from Cako again. :(  It's cute but there are WAY too many better bakeries.
author: Lisa C.

description: The selection isn't as great as their other stores but they are pleasant and the cup cakes are still amazing! Yummy!
author: Lyndsey C.

description:
there's a consistency with cako that has them expanding like a mini Starbucks,

I have to give this place four stars because my mom loves their tiramisu cupcake, and my mom's taste is more fickle and particular then mine--so whenever I want to bring her a treat, cako is one of my to go spots.

I love this location because for whatever reason, movie goers do not buy cupcakes as fast as retail shoppers at Westfield! 

so when Westfield is sold out of the flavour I need..almost always, I go here.

I got myself the limited flavour (hopefully not limited, but the girl said it was for Chinese New Years only) lychee..lychee! and yes, it was good
author: Whitne Y.

description:
I had pumpkin spice and strawberry-vanilla flavored cupcakes.  The server was very nice, enthusiastic and helpful.  The last strawberry flavored cupcake I wanted was taken by the couple in front of me and I was sooo sad!  But then one of the girls who had already finished her shift went into the back and frosted one for me!!!  How kind (*^^*).  I wish I remembered her name!  

I actually ate the cupcake about 2 days later and they tasted pretty good.  the frosting was delish and the cake was still moist.  

Btw, for those of you complaining about the price of the cupcakes, about $3.00-$3.50 is the going rate for cupcakes sold at bakeries like these (believe me, I've been to many both here and in LA) :)
author: Akunna O.

description:
Brought my best friend here to try the cupcakes since we are both cupake fanatics. I bought a six pack to take home to my husband and older son. She wasn't impressed by the offerings, so only bought one to take home to her daughter. She tends to prefer carrot or spice cake and they did not have anything like that on this day.

I bought two chocolate/chocolate cupcakes, two cookies & cream, a tiramisu and a snickers. I only got to try three of them, but my husband and son seemed to like all of the cupcakes they tried. I had parts of the chocolate/chocolate which was moist and delicious. I wish I could figure out how to get my chocolate buttercream as rich as theirs. I also had part of the chocolate snickers, which was a chocolate cupcake with a caramel buttercream, nuts and a mini snickers on top. Same cake as the other one, with a nice caramel buttercream. It wasn't overly impressive, but it was good. Lastly, I got the tiramisu cupcake all to myself and it was interesting as the cake was pretty much soaked in the rum/espresso mixture as a true ladyfinger in a tiramisu would be. It was yummy after I got over my initial surprise. 

I liked Cako better than the Kara's Cupcake I took home. I am not sure I would go out of my way to go back to Cako (like I will anytime I am semi-close to a Sprinkles), but I would try it again if it were convienent. If you like tiramisu, get one those cupcakes, they are delicious.
author: Lisa H.

description: Tasty, some-what above average cupcakes located in the new and rather slick looking Metreon complex.  Definitely a nice addition to the facility.  I had a great rainbow-spinkled cupcake with vanilla cake, and my wife had a nice red velvet.  I'm sure I'll grab another in the future when visiting the movie theaters, but I doubt I'll ever have one otherwise, nor would I ever travel out of my way to get one here.   I prefer Susiecakes and Kara's for sure...
author: Andy S.

description: Small selection. While the girl helping was very friendly and helpful, I thought the strawberry cheesecake cupcake was very disappointing. The consistency of the cream cheese frosting was very abnormal. Compared to my favorite cupcakery, Sift in Santa Rosa, this was such an epic fail. I definitely could have made a tastier/fresher cupcake myself. :(
author: Kelli H.

description:
Cake vs. cream.

Round one: http://www.yelp.com/biz/cako-creamery-san-francisco#hrid:grDFDm-ayDIZh3AVRaaZOw

Round two: Snickers cupcake satisfies www.youtube.com/watch?v=OTPJYZLD6L8

Haven't had one in ages. Chunk on top was big enough for a momentary trip back to when eating anything was completely acceptable. Loved that bite.

Sometimes long for those days.

Likely will long for another caramel frosting, peanut and chocolate cake Snickers cupcake too.
author: Jason B.

description: So glad Cako was dishing out samples at the New Metreon Community Celebration.  Their vanilla cupcakes were just what I needed as I perused the new digs. Nothing like a sugar high as you check out the moving trees in the lobby.  Wait, what?
author: Maria S.

description: Really yummy. So moist and buttery!  $3 for a cupcake seems really expensive... but the price probably saved me because if it were cheaper I would have ordered 10 and eaten them all at once ;)
author: Maddy O.

description:
I found a new favorite flavor. Maple Bacon.  I also got the Bailey's but that wasn't nearly as good, hence the four stars. The cute latina was helpful and friendly. 
This new location being next to my job can really affect my blood sugar levels.
author: Roger H.

description: Put it this way. We bought 5 cupcakes and polished off 4 in record time. These were great! We are visiting from Orange county, home of sprinkles and many others. These are the best by far. Strawberry cheesecake and tiramisu were fantastic.
author: Natalie D.

description:
Cako is not bad at all.  There are just 'so' many cupcakeries out there now, it's hard to make a name for oneself.

Cupcakes: I got to try the Apple Pie, the Red Velvet and the Strawberry Cheesecake.  They were all pretty good but the Apple-Pie was definitely my favorite!

Service: Outstanding!  The girl helping us out was super cheerful and way helpful!

Location: Heart of Downtown at the Metreon is the perfect place for an shoppers, movie goers or people on their way back to the parking garage from work etc.

I would definitely come back here again :)
author: Anthony L.

description:
I got a cupcake to go for my Metreon movie-viewing experience last night.  It was late in the day so there wasn't a lot of inventory left.  I'd been hoping to try the Maple Bacon but, since they were sold out, I opted for the Cookies and Cream.

Methinks the folks at Cako are using Duncan Hines mixes.  The cake had that sticky, fake-chocolatey, "I came from a box"  flavor I detest.  The fact that the cupcakes are refrigerated doesn't help matters: it made the cake crumbly and the "buttercream" (in quotes because I don't think it was actually buttercream) kind of crack when I bit into it.  As for the cookies and cream flavor?  There's a stale mini Oreo perched on top.  That's your cookies and cream.

$3.25 was a lot to spend on this cupcake.  The only positive thing about Cako was the customer service.  The girl behind the counter was very sweet.
author: Joanna L.

description: Macaron ice cream Sammie?!!!! Omg. I thought these only existed in SoCal from milk! It was love. I ordered the red velvet macaron with mango vanilla ice cream. I seriously didn't want it to end. The ice cream wasnt too sweet and the macaron was just right, not too crunchy and not too soft. Perfection!! The rose macaron was delicious as well. I was a little hesitant because it smelled strongly like roses. But these roses did not smell like boo oo oo. It was light and slightly creamy. If you are turned off by the "perfumey taste" this may or may be for you. But if you're feeling adventurous please try!! But if you don't get the Macaron Sammie.... I'll be speechless while shaking my head in disapproval. Don't disappoint yourself now!
author: Christina H.

description: Honestly  - I'm not the type to write a long review for cupcakes.  So all I will say is that this is a clean location in the metreon building, selection is nice, and the cupcakes are LEGIT.  Expensive - but so is Heroin once they get you hooked.
author: Arthur Y.

description:
Had the Strawberry Cheesecake (which I was told is their best seller) and the Snickerdoodle.  The Strawberry was not bad, except that it was room temperature.  I don't know about you, but I prefer cheesecake and cream cheese icing cold - instead warm and mushy.  The Snickerdoodle was quite good and moist, a bit more cinnamon flavor could have helped.  

The service was great.  Very friendly and personable young woman working on Sunday afternoon.
author: Curt Y.

description:
LOCATION: great. Its in the metreon which is close to my work. they have two little nooks one side for ice cream the other side for cupcakes. 

SERVICE: AWESOME. FRIENDLY. I would like to thank that Chris guy for always asking how my day is every time. 

PRICE: Its a bit pricey for ice cream. But I guess its also cuz of the brand itself. 

FOOD: my favorite cupcake now is the TIRAMISU cupcake. It tastes just like the cake itself. Also, I love the bailey's ice cream. You can actually taste the baileys in it but then the chocolate follows it right after making it a sweeter treat.

OVERALL: good service. good food. Definitely will tell friends.
author: Isabel N.

description: I bought a deal from yelp which is $10 for $20. I went to cako on metreon tonight. The  cashier said all she could do with the deal I bought was giving me $10 for $12!!!! WTF!!!! I wouldn't bother buying the deal if it's for $2 discount! What a fucking joke! I guess they have so many deals online that their staffs couldn't keep up of the deals and gave you another deal (probably $5 for $12 or something) instead of $10 for $20 that I bought! I redeemed it anyway. Pissed me off though. They should have at least know all of the deals they have online and let the customer use the actual deal that they bought not something else! Stupid! I don't think I would go to this cako again or at least not when this clueless girl who work on Saturday's night working!
author: Joey P.

description: Got the cinnamon donut muffin. Delicious, soft, light, and not too overwhelming with the cinnamon. The guy serving was also very nice and energetic, but it seems like every flavor is his 'favorite'.
author: Bernard M.

description: Stopped by as running thru town to catch train. Had the samoa cupcake. Was moist and good flavor.
author: Mollie T.

description:
Went to the Metreon to check out Target. Bf and I were hungry and I want to try as many cupcake shops as possible so we stopped by. We were really really tempted to try the maple bacon cupcake, but we're not impulsive enough. I got the Snickers cupcake because the Bf was not supportive of my pumpkin cheesecake cupcake first pick. He got the pink lemonade cupcake. It was amazing!!! So good. He didn't taste the pink lemonade but he also ate it in three bites. I thought it was very well balanced, light and moist. My Snickers cupcake was alright. Super duper dense chocolate flavor. The cupcake wasn't very light or balanced, it tasted like diabetes. None of this means I didn't enjoy it, it was just too rich to eat all at once. 

Cashier was friendly enough. She looked exhausted, poor girl.
author: Heather M.

description: I came close to when it was closing time so the cupcake I had probably wasn't as fresh had I came much earlier in the day. I had always wanted to try their cupcakes so since I was in the area here was my opportunity. There weren't many options left (because it was already later in the day) so what I did choose was the Strawberry Cheesecake Cupcake. It was really pretty but it was a little dry. Even though my first experience here wasn't quite what I hoped, I will still come back because I am interested to try their Maple Bacon cupcake! :)
author: Mel P.

description: I had the chocolate and marshmallow cupcake and thought it was ALMOST perfect.  It crumbled everywhere, so I'm not sure I was actually able to eat more than half of it...on account of the crumbs I lost. But it was good.  And I would go back.  :)
author: Emily Y.

description: Worst delivery service and customer service ever. I placed an ordered on cako.com a day before valentine requesting and paying $15 delivery for be made at 12:30-1PM. The order did not arrive until 2:40PM being nearly 2 hours late. I called the line nearly four times and only had voice mails where no one can help me. After managing to reach the mall-store in SF, over 3 employees took down my info and never called me back. By the fourth time, I managed to reach an employee by the name of Claire who actually understood my frustrations and tried to reach her boss. The order came 20 minutes later. Overall, never ordering from here again or dealing with this time of operation/store. Goodbye Cako, first and LAST time!
author: Linda L.

description: My coworker and I walked by and had to stop.  Love this new location in the metreon.  the cupcakes were fresh.  We got snickers, and pumpkin creme.  Both got raves.  On another trip, I had tried the tiramisu and loved that.  Will need to try the other flavors gradually.  It's hard to transport though so would recommend eating on the spot.  i brought mine back to the office and most of the frosting had gotten smeared on the bag, which is good from a caloric point of view, I guess..
author: Bebe W.

description: Looks can be deceiving...the cupcakes on the display looked pretty however taste wise, not too good.  I tried the red velvet cupcake. It was not moist nor tasty. This makes me miss sprinkles... A LOT. =(
author: Ann L.

description: Had the caramel apple cupcake and it was SO moist! The frosting was just right with a yummy apple and cinnamon pie filling and caramel on top. Delicious!
author: Melanie D.

description:
lemme tell you guys how my experience with cako went down.

so i have this thing for cupcakes: like i really, really, like them. then i discovered that cako carried ice cream cupcakes and i freaked the fuck out because that sounds like mmmmm-mmmmmmm hella tasty. the girl behind the counter sold them so well, she could see the excitement in my eyes, she knew that i was in it 2 win it. so i ordered the red velvet ice cream cupcake. i payed my $. i opened the package. and as i stuck my plastic spoon into that cupcake i realized that i had just bought a mothafuckin brick. that thing was not at all edible-at least not in frozen form. the icing i was able to taste was a lot more like syrup, really sticky and sweet, but with the aftertaste of artificial sweetener. the cake was dried out, but the only thing that wasn't titanium grade after being put in the freezer, so it's really all i ate. i can't even comment on the ice cream because i got frustrated and threw that lil' bitch away. sorry cako, peace n blessins!
author: Nick B.
Sandra T.

description: I love the cupcakes!!!!!! Best i ever had in my life!!! No joke
author: Tina C.

description: I sort of discovered Cako Bakery when I was visiting the newly opened Westfield Metreon. Cako also has a creamy there, but I am only reviewing the bakery since I only tried their cupcakes.  I had the Tiramisu cupcake which was a Vanilla Cake with Espresso, Mascarapone Frosting and Cocoa Powder. My wife had the S'mores cupcake, which was light. The Marshmallow top had just the right softness that tastes like the ones I put over the bonfire.  Both of them are very yummy that I would go back and try other flavors.
author: Phil N.

description: Try the red velvet ice cream - unreal! Quite possibly the best ice cream I've ever had. The red velvet cupcake itself was slight above average.
author: Keith K.

description: Love, love, love the strawberry cheesecake cupcake!  It has a graham cracker crust and cheesecake in the middle!
author: Angie B.

description: I am not a cake or cupcake person at all. I have never been. yeah I'm weird i know. but when i tried their Tiramisu cupcake can you say orgasm in my mouth?!? it was AMAZING! the staff is so nice and friendly that i dont mind paying 3.25 for a cupcake. Also the baileys ice cream is amazing. (:
author: Angeline N.

description: I had high hopes for this place based on the reviews here, but I was so disappointed. I can't remember the exact name of the cupcake but it was supposed to be an espresso flavored cupcake. It was a vanilla cupcake with an espresso shot dumped in the middle then topped with icing that wasn't memorable. The cake ended up being soggy. I felt cheated for one of their more expensive cupcakes.
author: Vivien H.
